byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Shukria Mekdad’s appointment has led critics to question the World Health Organization’s impartiality, as her husband is a defender of the government’s war effort.

headline.print_headline: W.H.O. Hires Wife of Top Figure in Syrian War to Assist Refugees
headline.main: U.N. Agency Hires Wife of Top Figure in Syrian War to Assist the Displaced

snippet: Shukria Mekdad’s appointment has led critics to question the World Health Organization’s impartiality, as her husband is a defender of the government’s war effort.
abstract: World Health Organization draws heavy criticism for its conduct in Syria, especially hiring of Syrian foreign minister's wife to asses mental health of people displaced by conflict; experts question objectivity of data collected by person intimately linked to one of war's enablers; agency's supporters cite challenges of working amid relentless violence and navigating delicate diplomatic relationships.
